channel.title: [Beta] RSC Single Player
channel.description:
[i][font=georgia]Version: 1.0[/font][/i]
RSC Single Player is a one player RuneScape Classic clone. You do not need any sort of internet connection what-so-ever to play this game.
This is essentially the ProjectRSC base, with stripped networking and packet handling. It has taken me almost 6 months to complete this and create new loading routines, however it is finally fully functional. The client handles itself and uses no server whatsoever.
[i]The game mode is currently set to F2P with nearly all content included. This includes all F2P skills, NPC chats, and most quests.[/i]
[b]Requirements[/b] * Java 6+
[b]Instructions[/b] * To launch you can either double click the 'classic.jar' file, or use the run.bat (Windows) or run.sh (Unix) * To create a new account, click the "New User" button and fill out the information below * Login and play
[b]Known bugs[/b] * Loading distant regions (ex: teleporting or ::stuck) sometimes causes a crash (if this happens, hit the close button on the window - your character will still save) * Loading screen does not work on some computers
[b]Latest updates[/b] * Release
[b]Notes[/b] * This is just the BETA. The experience modifiers are very high, however this version (1.0) will only be available for a limited time. * You can skip the tutorial or unstuck your character by using the command ::stuck
[img]http://i61.tinypic.com/2j0z3iu.png[/img]
[img]http://i61.tinypic.com/2vux5yt.png[/img]
[b]Download[/b] * [url=http://project-java.com/assets/projects/rsc/rsc_single_v1.0.zip]http://project-java.com/assets/projects/rsc/rsc_single_v1.0.zip[/url]

item.description:
@Fabrice_L wrote:

[quote=“Zoso_, post:11, topic:553371”][quote author=gawdz666 link=topic=672287.msg4496643#msg4496643 date=1443652010]

Run it from the command line and tell me the stacktrace

This is the stacktrace

java.io.FileNotFoundException: cache/players/Ass.txt (No such file or directory)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:146)
	at com.jagex.rsc.engine.model.player.Player.a(Unknown Source)
	at com.jagex.rsc.a.n.a(Unknown Source)
	at com.jagex.rsc.client.mudclient.c(Unknown Source)
	at com.jagex.rsc.client.mudclient.ad(Unknown Source)

[/quote]

Try creating an account with all lowercase letters for the time being. I’ll fix that in the next version :)[/quote]

Same thing bud

item.title: [Beta] RSC Single Player
item.dc:creator: @Zoso1 Zoso_
item.description:
@Zoso1 wrote:

Zach Knight:

I didn’t have time to download or look at it, but that’s not the easiest thing in the world to write so that’s pretty cool guy. I’m also not going to for a few months because my laptop was stolen and I won’t be fudgeing with RSC til I replace it, which may be a while right now. I’ll put it on a flash drive for safe keeping. It seems like it’d also be boring as shit, though, especially with no quests.

Cool sounds good. Also, it clearly says that most of the quests are completed (including Dragon Slayer), so I don’t know what you mean by that.

Read full topic

item.title: [Beta] RSC Single Player
item.dc:creator: @Zoso1 Zoso_
item.description:
@Zoso1 wrote:

[font=georgia]Version: 1.0[/font]

RSC Single Player is a one player RuneScape Classic clone.
You do not need any sort of internet connection what-so-ever to play this game.

This is essentially the ProjectRSC base, with stripped networking and packet handling. It has taken me almost 6 months to complete this and create new loading routines, however it is finally fully functional. The client handles itself and uses no server whatsoever.

The game mode is currently set to F2P with nearly all content included. This includes all F2P skills, NPC chats, and most quests.

Requirements
* Java 6+

Instructions
* To launch you can either double click the ‘classic.jar’ file, or use the run.bat (Windows) or run.sh (Unix)
* To create a new account, click the “New User” button and fill out the information below
* Login and play

Known bugs
* Loading distant regions (ex: teleporting or ::stuck) sometimes causes a crash (if this happens, hit the close button on the window - your character will still save)
* Loading screen does not work on some computers

Latest updates
* Release

Notes
* This is just the BETA. The experience modifiers are very high, however this version (1.0) will only be available for a limited time.
* You can skip the tutorial or unstuck your character by using the command ::stuck

Download
* http://project-java.com/assets/projects/rsc/rsc_single_v1.0.zip

Read full topic
